definition: to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave

sentences.english: In this age of the keyboard , some people seem to think handwriting lessons are on the way out.
sentences.chinese: 在这个键盘的年代，有人似乎认为书法课即将灭亡。

sentences.english: This poor woman will go to her grave without ever achieving her goal.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的女人实现不了她的目标，她会自取灭亡。

sentences.english: In China they helped cause the collapse of the Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 而在中国，又促成了明王朝的灭亡。

sentences.english: There was a serious train accident near the border. Two people were killed and twelve were injured.
sentences.chinese: 疆域发生紧张列车变乱，二人灭亡，十二人负伤。

sentences.english: The Righteous One takes note of the house of the wicked and brings the wicked to ruin.
sentences.chinese: 义人思想恶人的家，知道恶人倾倒，必至灭亡。

sentences.english: After the downfall of the Tang Dynasty, China entered a chaotic period of the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝灭亡以后，中国的历史进入五代十国的混乱时期。

sentences.english: Whom the gods destroy, we Number1 do mad.
sentences.chinese: 上帝要谁灭亡，必先让他厉害。

sentences.english: It was that attack that finally sowed the seeds for Gaddafi's demise.
sentences.chinese: 正是这次报复事件为卡扎菲埋下了灭亡的种子。

sentences.english: Since then, the Japanese have been instrumental in nearly wiping out the Western grey whale population.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，日本人开始大肆捕鲸，西部灰鲸几近灭亡。

sentences.english: The collapse of the Han dynasty was followed by nearly four centuries of rule by warlords.
sentences.chinese: 汉朝灭亡后是长达四个世纪的军阀割据时代。

sentences.english: Rational fear is good - it stops us getting killed.
sentences.chinese: 合理的忧虑是好的，它让我们不至于灭亡。

sentences.english: For, lo, thine enemies, O LORD, for, lo, thine enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，你的仇敌都要灭亡，一切作孽的也要离散。

sentences.english: And the remnant of the Philistines will perish, Says the Lord Jehovah.
sentences.chinese: 非利士人所余剩的必都灭亡，这是主耶和华说的。

sentences.english: To wipe out Xixia , the Song government engaged in Xihelu carefully.
sentences.chinese: 宋政府悉心经营熙河路，目的是为灭亡西夏打基础。

sentences.english: Nanzhao itself collapsed from internecine warfare shortly after the Tang Dynasty fell.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝灭亡不久，南昭国因内乱也开始崩溃瓦解。

sentences.english: The fall of the West Rome Empire marked the beginning of feudalism in Eurpoe.
sentences.chinese: 西罗马帝国的灭亡标志着欧洲封建制度的开始。

definition: fall (of an empire)
to be defeated and dispersed
destruction
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to lose a war
to die out/to wither away
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
regime/political power
to commit genocide/to become extinct/extinction of a race
to conquer/to defeat (militarily)
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
(of a country) to perish/to be annexed/subjugation (to a foreign power)
to surrender/surrender
